title: Tyreek Hill injury FAQ: Recovery timetable, his NFL future and how Dolphins will adapt
content: What is the Dolphins WR's outlook for a dislocated knee, the on-field impact of his absence and his future in Miami.

title: Hill carted off in Dolphins' win with dislocated knee
content: Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill dislocated his knee during Monday night's game and was to remain hospitalized overnight, according to coach Mike McDaniel.

title: Glenn blasts 'disappointing' Jets after sloppy loss
content: After watching 60 minutes of error-strewn football, New York Jets coach Aaron Glenn ripped into his winless team with a locker room rant that was heard in the adjacent media room.

title: Bochy, winningest active manager, out in Texas
content: Bruce Bochy, who guided the Rangers to their only World Series championship, will not return as manager in 2026, the team announced Monday.

title: Chase on loss: Didn't look like Bengals 'wanted it'
content: Cincinnati star Ja'Marr Chase, an All-Pro receiver who finished with five catches for just 23 yards Monday in the Bengals' loss to the Denver Broncos, told reporters that "at the end of the day, we gotta want it. Today, it didn't look like we wanted it."

title: LeBron: Contract status 'doesn't bother me at all'
content: Despite being a 21-time All-Star coming off an All-NBA second team selection and playing with no long-term financial commitment from the Lakers, LeBron James said his contract situation will not affect his performance this season.

title: Kawhi: Allegations of no-show deal not accurate
content: Kawhi Leonard said that he doesn't "think it's accurate" that he performed no services for Aspiration, the now-bankrupt green banking company and Clippers team sponsor with which he signed a lucrative endorsement contract.

title: Sirianni: Brown's desire is to remain with Eagles
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni, asked about A.J. Brown's cryptic tweet following Sunday's game, said he believes Brown wants to remain in Philadelphia.

title: Bears coach regrets how TV interview received
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson expressed regret Monday over how his halftime interview during his team's Week 4 win against the Raiders was received.

title: The only MLB playoff preview you need: World Series odds, likely MVPs and how far all 12 teams will go
content: Have Fall Classic or bust hopes for the postseason? Here's why your squad could be playing deep into October ... or get sent home early.

title: Oregon in OT? Virginia's stunner? Bama's redemption? Ranking best games of Week 5﻿﻿
content: The heavyweight battles brought the goods, but there were even more thrillers. We rank Week 5's games.

title: How the Lynx's yearlong pursuit of WNBA title ended early in the semifinals
content: Since a runner-up finish a year ago, the Lynx focused on winning it all in 2025. Instead, they're out in the semis.

title: Caitlin Clark fuels women's memorabilia market growth
content: Sports collectibles industry experts say interest in Caitlin Clark cards is leading to growth in the women's memorabilia market overall, particularly for the WNBA.

title: 'Don't you talk s--- about Steven Seagal': MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: Best, worst of NFL Week 4: Nix, defense lead Broncos over Bengals; Hill's injury overshadows Fins' win over Jets
content: Our NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 4.

title: Three losses through four weeks? Let's diagnose the Ravens' big problems and size up what's next
content: Baltimore came into the season with Super Bowl hopes but is now 1-3. What happened, and can the Ravens turn things around before it's too late?

title: How Europe backed Rory McIlroy's words, won Ryder Cup on the road
content: Two years ago in Rome, McIlroy predicted a win at Bethpage. Over three days, gutsy team play made it happen.

title: Inside the odds of the Guardians' remarkable comeback to win the AL Central
content: From 10.5 games back on September 1 to division champions, the Guardians defied the odds to overtake the Tigers.

title: Ranking the top freshmen so far in the 2025 college football season
content: Through five weeks, we've seen first-year players make huge contributions. These 11 players are standing out.

title: Dan Hurley on ego, Maui losses, Lakers -- and Geno Auriemma's wake-up call
content: In Hurley's "Never Stop: Life, Leadership, and What It Takes To Be Great," he writes that he reached out to Auriemma after UConn's 0-3 trip to the Maui Invitational last November.

title: Atlético Madrid serve up derby lesson, Liverpool get a wake-up call and more
content: Atletico Madrid turned back the clock to thrash their rivals in a game that will give both sides plenty to think about. Plus: Arsenal get a big win and Liverpool a wake-up call, as Gab Marcotti explains the weekend.

title: Ruben Amorim running out of excuses: The numbers don't lie
content: Soccer management is ultimately a numbers game, and none of them are adding up for Man United's manager.

title: Tracking MLB offseason manager changes: Bochy out in Texas, Baldelli and Melvin also out
content: The offseason carousel starts with openings in San Francisco, Minnesota and Texas. Here's who is out -- and who could be in line to replace them.

title: 10 moments that define 2025 Mets' epic collapse
content: The Mets nearly won a pennant last year -- and then added Juan Soto. And yet a season of promise turned into an all-time collapse.

title: Pickups: Replacing Malik Nabers, surprising RB options
content: Highlighting available free agent options after a weekend of surprising performances ahead of Week 5.

title: NFL Week 4's top performance?: Check out the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award results
content: Weigh in on Week 4's top player by casting a "Himmy" Award vote for Dak Prescott, DK Metcalf, Jaxson Dart or Puka Nacua.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: My First Bet for Week 5: Chiefs keep momentum, Lions pile on points
content: What immediately grabbed our attention once odds came out for Week 5? Here are early bets that stand out.

title: Who will make the 12-team College Football Playoff?
content: Select your favorite contender, make your picks for how its season will play out and see what the Allstate Playoff Predictor foretells.

title: MLS: Son keeps LAFC climbing as San Diego slips
content: Son Heung-Min and Denis Bouanga are dragging LAFC up the Western Conference table as well as the order in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs to return for Man City's Bernardo Silva
content: Saudi Pro League clubs want Manchester City midfielder Bernardo Silva despite failed approaches last summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 'India will not be deterred': CDS General rejects nuclear blackmail
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan emphasized India's crucial need to prepare for future bio-threats and radiological contamination, advocating for specialized treatment protocols. Speaking at the Military Nursing Service's 100th Raising Day, he lauded their selfless contributions, also highlighting the importance of caregiver well-being and data security in healthcare.

title: Mumbai-Delhi IndiGo flight receives bomb threat; full emergency declared at IGI airport
content: An IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Delhi, carrying around 200 people, received a bomb threat on Tuesday morning. Flight 6E 762 landed safely at Delhi airport around 7:53 am after a full emergency was declared. Security agencies later assessed the threat as non-specific, according to sources. An official statement from IndiGo regarding the incident is currently awaited.

title: Beer, whisky glasses in hands, 4 Ghaziabad cops groove at criminal's birthday party
content: Four Ghaziabad police officers, including a sub-inspector, were suspended after a video surfaced showing them dancing and drinking with a criminal named Irshad at his birthday party on September 27. The incident, which occurred at a Sahibabad bar, led to their suspension following an investigation and review of CCTV footage.

title: Techie couple found dead in Gurgaon flat; husband may have strangled wife first
content: A young software engineer couple, Ajay and Sweety, were found dead in their Gurgaon apartment, with police suspecting a murder-suicide. Ajay reportedly strangled Sweety before taking his own life, confessing in a video message to friends. Their troubled marriage, marked by separation and ongoing arguments, is believed to be the motive.

title: JP Morgan fraud: 32-year-old CEO duped US largest bank of $175mn; sentenced for 7 yrs
content: Charlie Javice, founder of Frank, was sentenced to seven years in jail for defrauding JPMorgan Chase of $175 million. She was convicted of faking over 4 million customers to facilitate the sale of her fintech startup. The judge highlighted her duplicity while also criticizing JPMorgan's inadequate due diligence during the acquisition.

title: Gold price prediction: May face resistance at Rs 121,000; is it right time to buy?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold is expected to trade with a positive bias, fueled by significant ETF inflows and rising expectations of Fed rate cuts. The yellow metal recently hit a record high of $3833, with major resistance anticipated at $4000.

title: 'PCB wants obedient, lallu-kattu kids': Akhtar slams Pakistan cricket
content: Legendary fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar delivered a scathing post-mortem of Pakistan’s Asia Cup 2025 final loss to India, criticising the PCB, captain Salman Agha, and coach Mike Hesson. He attributed the defeat to systemic flaws, including a lack of aggression, poor strategic choices, and the board's preference for "obedient kids" over strong personalities, advocating for grassroots reforms.

title: 15 companies that are now part of Apple's iPhone supply chain in India
content: Apple has dramatically expanded its iPhone manufacturing in India, with one in five iPhones now produced domestically. Its robust supply chain includes nearly 45 companies, integrating over 20 Indian MSMEs across several states. Driven by the PLI scheme, India's ecosystem produced $45 billion worth of iPhones, exporting 76%. This surge propelled smartphone exports to become India's top export by 2024-25.

title: Trump administration opens proceedings to bar Harvard from federal funds
content: The Trump administration has initiated proceedings to block Harvard University from receiving federal funding, referring it to the suspension and debarment process. This move, citing "deliberate indifference" to antisemitism, could cut off billions in research grants across multiple agencies, escalating the conflict. Harvard has 20 days to challenge the referral.

title: 'Ran away with the trophy': Surya slams Mohsin Naqvi after Asia Cup final drama
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph was overshadowed by extraordinary post-match scenes as captain Suryakumar Yadav alleged ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi ran away with the trophy. The Indian team collectively refused to accept it from Naqvi, who is also PCB chairman, leading to a chaotic presentation. BCCI confirmed it would file a formal complaint against Naqvi's actions.

title: Karur stampede: 2nd TVK functionary Masi Pavunraj arrested
content: Karur central town secretary Masi Pavunraj and west district secretary Mathiazhagan were arrested following a stampede at actor Vijay's rally that killed 41 people. The incident led to a police investigation, with key TVK functionaries named as prime suspects. Union Ministers and the Chief Minister have responded, calling for probes and better crowd management at public gatherings.

title: Accenture layoffs: 11,000 cut; CEO says ‘we are exiting" employees we can't retrain
content: Accenture has laid off over 11,000 employees in the past three months, citing their inability to be retrained in AI skills, as it reshapes its workforce for the AI era. The company is simultaneously expanding its AI capabilities and plans to increase headcount, reflecting a broader industry trend of adapting to AI or facing obsolescence.

title: ‘Under foreign pressure’: BJP blasts Chidambaram for 26/11 retaliation remark; targets Sonia
content: The Bhartiya Janta Party criticized former union home minister P Chidambaram. He recently stated the UPA government did not retaliate after the 26/11 Mumbai attacks. Chidambaram mentioned foreign pressure influenced this decision. The BJP accused the Congress of mishandling the situation. They questioned the UPA's accountability regarding the terror incident. This sparked a political debate.

title: Three days before Gandhi Jayanti, statue vandalised in London
content: A Mahatma Gandhi statue in London faced vandalism. The incident occurred at Tavistock Square. Graffiti defaced the monument. Indian mission officials visited the site. They informed local authorities about the damage. Restoration efforts are now underway. The Indian High Commission condemned this act. It called the act a violent attack. This happened days before Gandhi Jayanti celebrations.

title: Harvest Moon 2025: When and how to see the rare full moon this October
content: The Harvest Moon, a unique celestial event historically vital for farmers, will appear unusually late in October 2025, gracing skies on the 6th and 7th. This rare occurrence, happening only 18 times between 1970-2050, offers a prolonged presence near sunset due to a shallow ecliptic angle. Visible globally, it connects skywatchers to nature's enduring cycles and ancient traditions.

title: Former Pakistan player attacks India, calls team a 'joke of world cricket'
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal urged the PCB to boycott India matches following a controversial Asia Cup trophy presentation. India's team reportedly refused the trophy from Mohsin Naqvi, ACC head and PCB chairman, due to his anti-India sentiments. Akmal criticized India's "cheap behaviour," suggesting a neutral committee investigate the tournament's contentious incidents, escalating tensions between the rival boards.

title: 'Viable pathway to peace': PM Modi welcomes Trump's Gaza proposal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed US President Donald Trump's comprehensive 21-point plan to end the Gaza conflict, which began on October 7, 2023. The proposal calls for an immediate ceasefire, hostage release, and civilian protection, stressing regional cooperation and international monitoring. India, a long-time advocate for a two-state solution, notes the plan as over 65,000 Palestinians have been killed.

title: ‘Pro red-terror’: BJP slams Congress, CPI over naxal ops; calls them ‘tudke tudke gang’
content: CPI general secretary D Raja questioned the government's "Naxal mukt Bharat" initiative, urging talks with Naxal groups and criticizing the BJP's broader agenda. This stance drew sharp criticism from the BJP, which accused the CPI and its INDIA alliance partners, including Congress, of supporting Maoist violence and compromising internal security.

title: Indonesia: 65 students trapped as school building collapses; 1 dead
content: An unauthorized expansion caused an Islamic boarding school building to collapse in Indonesia, killing one student and injuring 99 others. Sixty-five students, mostly boys, are feared buried under heavy debris in Sidoarjo, East Java. Rescue teams are working tirelessly to save those trapped, while families anxiously await news of their children.

title: Pothole pangs: Bengaluru college student run over by truck; residents flag bad roads
content: A 20-year-old student, Dhanushree, tragically died in Bengaluru after being run over by a speeding truck near Budigere Cross. While police investigate if potholes contributed, residents blame poor road conditions and lack of streetlights. The truck driver fled, and a case for negligence has been registered. This incident reignites concerns over city road safety and infrastructure.

title: Anti-Hamas meme: British blogger arrested; UK officers suspect 'racial hatred'
content: A British blogger, Pete North, 47, was arrested in Yorkshire for sharing an "anti-Hamas" meme on social media, which also contained offensive remarks about Palestine and Islam. Detained on suspicion of stirring up racial hatred, North questioned the arresting officer's knowledge of Hamas. He was later released without charge, but remains under investigation.

title: Watch: Hero's welcome! Tilak Varma gets rousing reception after Asia Cup heroics
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 final hero, Tilak Varma, received a thunderous welcome in Hyderabad after his match-winning 69 not out against Pakistan. The 22-year-old anchored India's chase, securing their record-extending ninth title and showcasing his exceptional temperament in high-pressure games. Fans celebrated their homegrown star's return with immense pride at the airport.

title: Capitol riot lawsuit: YouTube to pay $22 million for suspending Donald Trump's account
content: YouTube settled a lawsuit with Donald Trump for $22 million. This followed his account suspension after the January 6 Capitol attack. The funds will support Trump’s White House construction project. Other Trump allies also received payments. This settlement is part of ongoing resolutions for Trump’s lawsuits against tech firms. X and Meta previously settled similar cases. Google faces broader scrutiny.

title: Anthony Edwards reveals Michael Jordan’s advice ahead of 2025-26 NBA season
content: Minnesota Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards made headlines at Media Day, revealing unique advice from Michael Jordan on mastering his mid-range game. Edwards, who diligently studied legends like Jordan and Kobe Bryant, shared insights into his improved post-up techniques. He also candidly expressed missing former teammates Jarred Vanderbilt and Josh Okogie, highlighting the strong bonds he forged within the team.

title: 'Stabbed her 45 times': B'luru man murders wife, hangs self; father discovers grisly scene
content: A 29-year-old man allegedly killed his 27-year-old wife by stabbing her multiple times, then ended his own life in their Bengaluru home on Sunday. Manju P, a nurse, sustained around 45 injuries. Police suspect Dharmaseelan Ramesh committed the act due to suspicions about her workplace friendships.

title: How Asia Cup 2025 trophy presentation turned into a diplomatic standoff
content: India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan descended into controversy as the Indian team refused to accept the trophy from ACC President Mohsin Naqvi, citing his social media posts and diplomatic tensions. Naqvi, also Pakistan's interior minister, subsequently removed the trophy, leading to India celebrating without it. The incident escalated into a political spat between the two nations.

title: Rare Australian fragments reveal lost ancient asteroid,crater mystery puzzled
content: Scientists found rare glass fragments in Australia. These ananguites reveal a massive ancient asteroid impact. The collision occurred millions of years ago. The crater remains undiscovered. This discovery suggests more hidden impacts on Earth than previously thought. It helps understand our planet's cosmic history. This finding also aids in assessing future asteroid risks.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex above 80,400
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was above 24,650, BSE Sensex was up around 100 points.

title: JEE main 2026: NTA issues advisory; details here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has issued an advisory for JEE Main 2026 aspirants to update Aadhaar details, UDID cards, and category certificates before registration begins in October 2025. The exam will be held in two sessions: January and April 2026. Candidates are urged to ensure accurate documents to avoid rejection. Official updates will be available at nta.ac.in and jeemain.nta.nic.in.

title: Vijay Kumar Malhotra passes away: BJP veteran leader dies at 93
content: Senior BJP leader and former MP Vijay Kumar Malhotra passed away at 93 in New Delhi. A prominent figure in Delhi politics for over four decades, he was a five-time MP and two-time MLA. Malhotra notably defeated former PM Manmohan Singh in 1999, significantly building the party's base in the capital.

title: Ladakh: Govt intrigued at violence even after ‘unprecedented’ vikas; fringes in focus
content: Ladakh grapples with unrest despite significant post-2019 development, including enhanced connectivity, education, and tourism, officials claim. They find it ironic given the region's progress since gaining UT status. However, the violence stems from long-standing demands for statehood, Sixth Schedule protections, and resource control, which local bodies have consistently raised, overshadowing perceived development gains.

title: FTA push: EU envoy flags missed opportunity; calls for full engagement by year-end
content: The 13th India-EU FTA round was a "missed opportunity," though both aim for a year-end deal, with another round set for October 6. Lingering issues persist, notably India's Russia ties, including energy and military exercises, which the EU views as an impediment to deeper relations despite shared strategic diversification goals.

title: New beginning? Trump, Netanyahu back Gaza peace plan; Hamas stance unclear
content: Trump's 20-point peace plan for Gaza: Gaza will be deradicalized, terror-free zone and all hostages, alive or dead, will be returned. Trump will lead a Board of Peace and a temporary government will take over Gaza. If Hamas does not reject the plan, Israel will "finish the job" and it will have Trump's full backing.

title: Argentina deal: Donald Trump admin's chat leaked - here’s what it reads
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's leaked text revealed Argentina sold soybeans to China after a US bailout, violating a trade deal. This move, criticized by Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins and others, has severely impacted US soybean farmers already struggling with Chinese tariffs and falling prices, despite President Trump's "America First" slogan.

title: US gov shutdown to hit hard! Firing allowed, hiring frozen - Trump admin reveals plans
content: A US government shutdown looms as funding talks stall. The Trump administration plans mass layoffs and government scaling. Health and Human Services will furlough many employees. Economic data release will pause. Veterans Affairs cemeteries maintenance will stop. The Internal Revenue Service will operate fully. This shutdown will differ from past events.

title: Karur tragedy: Stampede FIR names 3 of Vijay’s party; 1 arrested
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam's Karur secretary Mathiazhagan was arrested Monday night, named a prime suspect in the September 27 stampede that killed 41 people. Police alleged delays, mismanagement, and chaos at actor Vijay’s rally triggered the fatal crowd crush. General secretary Bussy Anand and joint general secretary CTR Nirmal Kumar were also implicated.

title: Myanmar earthquake: 4.7 magnitude tremors felt across Assam, Manipur
content: A magnitude 4.7 earthquake struck Myanmar near the India border early Tuesday, causing tremors across Manipur, Nagaland, and Assam. This seismic event, centered southeast of Ukhrul, followed a 3.4 magnitude quake in Maharashtra and a 3.3 magnitude tremor in Tibet, indicating recent widespread seismic activity.

title: Chennai drug bust: Bollywood actor held with 3.5kg cocaine; haul worth Rs 35cr
content: A Bollywood supporting actor was apprehended at Chennai airport with 3.5kg of cocaine, valued at ₹35 crore, in a joint Customs and DRI operation. Arriving from Singapore, the actor had the drugs concealed in his luggage's false bottom. Officials suspect he was a courier for cartels, possibly destined for Mumbai or Delhi.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Somil Mehta of Mirae Asset Sharekhan recommends Apl Apollo Tubes Ltd and Hindustan Zinc as top stocks to buy today. Both stocks exhibit bullish flag patterns and positive momentum indicators.

title: FBI arrests four 'illegals' for aiming laser at CBP helicopter
content: Federal agents raided a Portland home following an incident where an individual allegedly aimed a laser at a Customs and Border Protection helicopter and another aircraft. All four occupants of the residence were found to be in the U.S. illegally and are now in custody.

title: 'Gussa ho rhe ho aap': Suryakumar destroys Pakistani journalist
content: India's T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav addressed the Asia Cup 2025 final controversy where his team boycotted handshakes with Pakistan and refused the trophy from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi. This sparked debate about politics in cricket, with Yadav facing tough questions. He later pledged his match fees to the Indian Army, as diplomatic tensions overshadowed India's tournament victory.

title: NFL trade rumors: Russell Wilson’s future with Giants grows more uncertain
content: Russell Wilson, benched by the New York Giants for rookie Jaxson Dart, is reportedly a trade candidate before the November 4 deadline, according to NFL insider Ian Rapoport. Despite a difficult start to the season and fan criticism, Wilson remains positive and committed to the team, publicly stating his desire to stay and support Dart.

title: Chaitanyananda Saraswati confronted with female aides; pictures, messages with women found on his phone
content: Chaitanyananda Saraswati’s phones also had multiple photographs of him with air hostesses and screenshots of display pictures of women, police said

title: Pre-partition Bengal, Indian freedom movement emerge as popular themes in Kolkata’s Durga Pujas
content: This trend assumes significance with the resurgence of the Bengal’s pre-partition history and its freedom fighters in public consciousness, through ‘The Bengal Files’ controversy and with Trinamool’s ‘Bengali pride’ campaign

title: Gandhi statue in London vandalised, Indian mission strongly condemns violent act
content: The Indian mission said it has reported the desecration to the local authorities, even as its officials are at the site to coordinate the restoration of the monument to its original state

title: 3 militants arrested in Manipur
content: An active member of the proscribed Peoples' Liberation Army (PLA) was arrested near his house in Kadangband in Imphal West district on September 29, they said.

title: 71st Wildlife Week to be celebrated in Karnataka from October 2–8
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will inaugurate the week-long celebrations on October 2 by flagging off a walkathon from Vidhana Soudha to Lalbagh in Bengaluru

title: This year, Kolkata’s pandals put the spotlight on ‘Bengali pride’
content: Amid the ongoing controversy around Bengali language, identity, and crisis of migrant labourers Durga Pujas bring spotlight to the issue

title: Tamil Nadu: Candidates up to 40 years of age could now get admitted into UG courses in arts and science colleges
content: In case of candidates who are persons with disabilities, the upper age limit could further be relaxed by five years

title: Four-hour relaxation in curfew announced in Leh; forces deployed in strength
content: Additional District Magistrate in Leh, Ghulam Mohammed, ordered opening of all groceries, essential services, hardware and vegetable shops during the relaxation period

title: Former MP Prajwal Revanna challenges conviction in rape case in Karnataka High Court
content: Revanna, who was arrested in May last year after returning from Germany, is contesting the verdict on several grounds, including what he claims are contradictions in the survivor's testimony and inconsistencies in the evidence produced by the prosecution

title: Self-styled preacher Virender Deo Dixit wanted in rape cases has died, CBI tells court
content: Virender Deo Dixit, against whom an Interpol Blue Notice was issued in 2018, was allegedly on the run after the CBI registered cases against him on the orders of the Delhi High Court in 2017

title: YouTuber Felix Gerald arrested for video attributing motives to Karur stampede
content: The police said cases were registered against 25 social media account holders who posted rumours about the stampede and spread misinformation about the State government and police

title: Vijay Kumar Malhotra, veteran BJP leader, passes away at 94
content: Malhotra has been a five-time MP and two-time MLA from Delhi and was a prominent face of the party in the capital

title: Flood threat continues in Andhra Pradesh as Krishna, Godavari remain swollen
content: Two NDRF and three SDRF teams have been deployed in vulnerable areas; APSDMA Managing Director warns people against crossing overflowing streams, canals, or inundated roads

title: PM Modi welcomes Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan
content: The peace proposal for Gaza aims to end the war between Israel and Hamas militants and requires the return of all hostages, living and dead, within 72 hours of a ceasefire

title: Why was X’s ‘censorship’ challenge against Centre’s Sahyog portal rejected?
content: Experts told The Hindu that the ruling risks enabling sweeping censorship of information essential for ensuring political accountability

title: ’Union govt has imposed undeclared President’s rule in Punjab,’ says CM Mann
content: Mr. Mann was speaking on the discussion surrounding the State’s recent floods and rehabilitation during the special session of the Punjab State Assembly.

title: Tharoor flags concerns over Air India Express plans to curtail Kerala flights
content: Any curtailment of services at this stage will inevitably cause severe hardship to migrant workers, students, tourists and families, while also hampering trade and tourism, Shashi Tharoor says

title: UPSC finalises panel of three officers fit for appointment as T.N. DGP
content: Once the panel is received, the State would have to immediately appoint one of the officers as a regular DGP/HoPF with a minimum tenure of two years in compliance with the Supreme Court order.

title: Sociology student from Mumbai wins Srinivas Rayaprol Poetry Prize 2025
content: The prize, including a citation and cash award of ₹15,000, will be presented on October 25, marking the birth centenary of Srinivas Rayaprol.

title: ‘Fulfil poll promise on granting affiliation to Haryana schools’
content: The BJP had in its 2014 Assembly election manifesto promised that after forming the government, unrecognised schools would be granted one-time permanent affiliation by easing the norms

title: CSL expands CSR footprint into community-driven agriculture projects
content: CSL to back three major agriculture projects related to precision farming, including revival of a sprawling paddy field, installation of weather monitoring systems, and setting up a climate-resilient paddy processing unit

title: HC seeks to stop police from leaking alleged confession statements of accused to media
content: Even if in certain circumstances portions of such statements are made public, the police should clarify that they are not admissible as evidence against the accused in a criminal trial, said a Division Bench of Justice A.K. Jayasankaran Nambiar and Justice Jobin Sebastian

title: The RSS is a ‘ten-headed Ravana that represents regressive tendencies’: Congress leader
content: The ten faces stand for regressive tendencies like anti-constitutional behaviour, anti-religious attitudes, and anti-democratic actions. The destruction of these will be the real Vijayadashami

title: Karur stampede: TVK district secretary picked up for police inquiry
content: TVK’s Karur West district secretary V.P. Mathiyazhagan is named as accused number one in the FIR registered by the Karur Town police.

title: Watch: PM Modi urges citizens to back Indian products: “Say with pride – this is Swadeshi!”
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the new Delhi BJP office on September 29 during Navratri celebrations. In his address, he praised the NDA’s governance model, highlighting improvements in security, anti-corruption, and public savings. He cited increased tax exemptions and GST reforms that benefit common citizens. PM Modi also called on BJP workers to promote Swadeshi products with pride, encouraging every shop to display a bold sign reading, “Say with pride, this is Swadeshi.”

title: Uttar Pradesh on unstoppable path under CM Adityanath’s leadership, says Union Minister Goyal
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal praises Uttar Pradesh’s growth under Yogi Adityanath, highlighting safe business environment and investor-friendly policies

title: European envoys raise ‘Russia question’ amid deepening India-EU ties
content: EU Ambassador Herve Delphin says India buying Russian oil and its participation in Zapad military exercise worry Europe; he says it has to ‘square’ Russia partnership with desire to deepen ties with Europe

title: Karur stampede: Palaniswami terms probe panel ‘eyewash’, calls for CBI investigation
content: Contending that the people will not trust the government investigation, the former Chief Minister says, “For the people to know what really happened and to ensure justice, an investigation by the CBI should be ordered.”

title: Ahead of bypoll, over 4,000 voters added in Ghatshila Assembly constituency under Special Summary Revision in Jharkhand
content: Number of male voters in the draft publication was 1,23,314 and female voters’ number was 1,28,050; this has now increased to 1,24,899 and 1,30,921 respectively, in the final publication

title: Last rites of two more protesters held in Leh amid restrictions, curfew continues
content: Educational institutes remain closed, mobile Internet services are suspended; several pockets of Leh town, especially where the main government offices are located, continue to be barricaded with concertina wires

title: Paper leak protest called off after Dhami promises CBI probe
content: Vexed with the recent paper leak in the Uttarakhand Subordinate Services Selection Commission (UKSSSC) graduate-level examination held on September 21, students across the State launched massive protests forcing the government to form an SIT under the chairmanship of a retired High Court judge to investigate the leak. The students, however, remained adamant for a CBI probe

title: Portal glitches and ‘missing records’ slow down registration of Waqf
content: The registration of Waqf properties is moving at a sluggish pace owing to website glitches and record challenges

title: Media should give Palestinians the chance to tell our story: Palestine Ambassador
content: Palestine solidarity meet held on the opening day of International Media Festival of Kerala organised by Kerala Media Academy

title: Rajnath Singh to Celebrate Vijayadashami with Soldiers in Bhuj
content: He will also travel to the forward post at Harami Nala near the India-Pakistan border to interact with the Army and BSF personnel.

title: Tibetan refugee injured during Ladakh protests, recovering in AIIMS ICU
content: A 21-year-old student of nursing in Bengaluru was airlifted from Leh on September 24 and admitted at the ICU in Jai Prakash Narayan Trauma Centre of AIIMS, New Delhi

title: Doctors stress importance of early diagnosis for full recovery in children with heart issues
content: Nutritional deficiencies or infections in mothers, less than two years of gap between two babies are some of the factors that influence heart disease risk in children, says a cardiologist during a heart health awareness programme organised by The Hindu  in association with Andhra Hospitals

title: U.S. tariffs will have long-term effect on trade: Commerce Ministry to PAC
content: Tariffs will significantly impact India’s marine exports, especially shrimp; Centre working on market diversification pushing for registration of more export units in the EU, and engaging in discussions with other countries, says Special Secretary

title: How Karur Medical College Hospital rose to the occasion during stampede tragedy
content: Inside the hospital, doctors, nurses and staff worked on a war footing. Nearly 85 doctors reported within hours of the incident, and about 90% of the hospital staff turned up without being summoned

title: Telangana’s 63-foot Bathukamma bursts into Guinness glory
content: Bathukamma festivities at Hyderabad’s Saroornagar Stadium makes history with two records — one for the largest floral goddess installation and another for a synchronised dance performance by more than 1,000 women

title: Tumakuru metro project moves a step closer to becoming a reality, says Parameshwara
content: The much-awaited Tumakuru metro project is inching closer to reality, Home Minister G. Parameshwara said

title: Apartment owners’ association bats for centralised sewer network in Kochi instead of individual STP units
content: Panel set up by the Kerala High Court will consider the association’s plea to resolve the issue by opting for a centralised network, especially in apartment complexes facing space constraints to install sewage treatment plants

title: TVK organisers deliberately delayed arrival of Vijay in Karur, claims FIR of Karur Town police
content: People who waited in large numbers for several hours without water and medical assistance experienced fatigue because of heat and crowding, which led to a stampede resulting in multiple deaths, says the FIR

title: Single-use plastic ban: municipalities in Ernakulam collect over ₹5 lakh as penalty this fiscal
content: Perumbavoor municipality has levied the highest penalty among the 13 municipalities, with enforcement squads collecting around ₹1.65 lakh

title: Kerala HC directs comprehensive inventory and expert evaluation of Sabarimala temple’s valuables
content: HC flays Travancore Devaswom Board for its alleged failure to maintain proper registers of valuables at the temple

title: PHC doctors announce suspension of OP, emergency services in State from September 30
content: Demand State government to increase the in-service quota in clinical departments from 15% to 20% as promised last year

title: BJP questions ‘silence’ of Congress, its allies on India’s victory over Pakistan in Asia Cup final
content: BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi says Opposition alliance, including Congress, is “always ready to side with Pakistan at every level, be it sports or diplomacy, and this is their true identity”

title: CM launches Citizen Connect Centre
content: The centre, established at Vellayambalam, will facilitate citizen feedback, grievances redressal, and public communication. The public can share their opinions, suggestions, and complaints through the toll-free number 1800-425-6789

title: BJP Veteran Vijay Kumar Malhotra Dies At 94
content: Veteran BJP leader Vijay Kumar Malhotra passed away at the age of 93 on Tuesday morning, the party said.

title: Muslim States Join European Powers In Backing Trump's Gaza Plan
content: Key Muslim nations on Monday threw their weight behind a plan by US President Donald Trump to end the war in Gaza, even as some Palestinians decried the proposal as a "farce".

title: UPS Vs NPS: What Changes For Central Government Employees
content: It's deadline day for central government employees to switch from the market-linked National Pension System (NPS) to the newly introduced Unified Pension Scheme (UPS).

title: Team Trump Signals "Significant" Changes In H-1B Visa Allotment Before 2026
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said there will be "a significant number of changes" in the H1B visa process before February 2026, when the new fee of USD 100,000 goes into effect.

title: "Preparedness Against Nuclear Threats Is Important": Defence Chief
content: Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Anil Chauhan said that bio-threats are likely to increase in the post-COVID pandemic era and called for defence preparedness against them.

title: "Let Me Touch You": Gaza Women Promised Food, Money, Work In Exchange For Sexual Interactions
content: As Gaza's humanitarian crisis grows, women say they have been exploited by local men - some associated with aid groups - promising food, money, water, supplies or work in exchange for sexual interactions.

title: Asian Development Bank Forecasts India's Growth At 6.5% For FY26
content: Despite a strong 7.8 per cent growth in the first quarter, the Indian economy is expected to grow at 6.5 per cent in the current financial year ADB said on Tuesday.

title: US Cops Pull Over A Car For Wrong U-Turn, Then A Plot Twist
content: The police said that the two officers stopped the car when they observed it making an illegal U-turn at a traffic signal.

title: Tamil YouTuber Felix Gerald Arrested For "Spreading Rumours" Over Karur Stampede
content: Noted Tamil YouTuber Felix Gerald was arrested on Tuesday for "spreading rumours" over the Karur Vijay rally stampede incident which claimed 41 lives and injured over 50, police said.

title: How US Government Shutdown May Impact Trump Administration
content: The United States is on the verge of yet another federal government shutdown, with prospects looking rather bleak for a last-minute compromise in Congress.

title: Donald Trump's Youngest Son Reserves Whole Floor At Trump Tower For Date: Report
content: Barron Trump, the youngest son of US President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump, shut down an entire floor of Trump Tower in New York for a private date.

title: Video: Flight To Surat Running Late, Passengers Perform Garba At Goa Airport
content: Surat-bound flight was scheduled to depart from Goa at 5 pm on Sunday evening. Passengers were looking forward to going to Surat and participating in Navratri festivities, particularly Garba. But the flight was delayed due to a technical issue.

title: On Delhi Sleaze Baba's Phone: Pics With Air Hostesses, Profile Pic Screenshots
content: New details have surfaced in the probe against the self-styled godman accused of sexually harassing over a dozen women at an ashram in Delhi.

title: Andhra Pradesh Couple, Child Injured In Suspicious Blast At Home
content: A couple was critically injured, and their child suffered minor injuries in a suspicious blast in their home in Andhra Pradesh's Alur district on Tuesday morning.

title: Pregnant Teen Slits Boyfriend's Throat With Knife He Threatened Her With
content: In a chilling case that has shaken Chhattisgarh, Raipur police on Sunday recovered the body of a young man from a lodge in the city's Ganj police station area.

title: Madagascar's President Fires Government Following Deadly Gen Z Protests
content: Madagascar President Andry Rajoelina fired the prime minister and the rest of his government Monday in response to days of deadly Gen Z-led protests in the Indian Ocean island over the failure of the electricity and water supplies.

title: PM Modi Welcomes Trump's Plans To End Gaza War: "Pathway To Long-Term Peace"
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has extended support to US President Donald Trump's new plan to end the Gaza conflict.

title: "They're Incredible": Trump Praises Pak PM, Asim Munir For Gaza Plan Support
content: US President Donald Trump has praised Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and the country's Army Chief, Field Marshal Asim Munir, for supporting Washington's proposed Gaza peace plan.

title: NWSL: Spirit emphatically book postseason berth
content: a round of NWSL action is in the books, which means it's time for ESPN's Power Rankings . our writers studied the action from across Matchday 22 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league . the current did concede in the 58th minute .

title: Flight passenger starts 'eating' passport, another tries to flush it down
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: NBA media day 2025: KD's birthday wish and Jokic's jokes lead best moments
content: the new york Knicks, new Orleans pelicans, Brooklyn Nets , Phoenix Suns and Philadelphia 76ers were the first five teams to hold media days last week . the rest of the league's media days to Monday .

title: Power Rankings: LSU drops 13 spots; BYU, Memphis and Louisville join the Top 25
content: the first full month of the 2025 college football season is officially in the books . some of the nation's biggest early-season surprises were once again on display . despite a leaky run defense, Alabama notched its latest win over Georgia on the road .

title: Ranking winners and losers, injury impacts from Sunday
content: RB, Las Vegas Raiders : Ashton Jeanty led all running backs through the late window on Sunday . he rushed for 138 yards and a touchdown on 21 carries, plus he added two receptions for 17 yards . the rookie could see a bump in pass game usage after his production .

title: 'Low power mode': Giants poke fun at Chargers, leading Week 4 trolls
content: the new york Giants beat the Los Angeles Chargers 21-18 at home . the Giants posted a photo of a broken phone charger with the caption: "low power mode" the Seattle Seahawks beat the Arizona Cardinals on "Thursday night football"

title: This year was supposed to be a Dodgers coronation; instead, it's an October crapshoot
content: the defending world Series champions had emerged from free agency with the best starter on the market, the best reliever on the marketplace and the best pitching prospect in the world . they were bound to be an all-time juggernaut, top to bottom, eons beyond any of their competitors . it wasn't 117, even if the number to set the game's single-game rotation was 117.

title: Giants are cursed, Titans destined for another top pick? Overreacting to Week 4
content: the Falcons racked up 435 total yards in a 34-27 victory over the -less Commanders . a second-year QB Michael Penix Jr. followed the worst game of his young career with his best . the two teams fought valiantly against the Commanders and Marcus Mariota .

title: 🏀 LeBron future, Celtics' goals: Big NBA questions
content: despite 22 days separating the preseason from opening night, not every team's offseason storylines have been resolved . how will the saga trickle into the Golden State Warriors ' season; how the LA Clippers will handle the league's investigation into Kawhi Leonard . what are the expectations for the Indiana Pacers this season are just some of the largest stories to follow .

title: Joe Burrow-less Bengals prove no match for Broncos' elite defense
content: the Denver Broncos had lost back-to-back games heading into their prime-time matchup against the Cincinnati Bengals . the sun eventually appeared before kickoff, and things looked much brighter for the home team . they had a defense that showed its elite potential once again, but against an offense without injured quarterback Joe Burrow .
